trustfund:
TF022164-PHRD 2-PRIVATIZATION
            IMPLEMENTATION ASSISTANCE,TF037422-ROMANIA - CEM,TF023319-DUTCH GRANT FOR THE ROMANIA
            PRIVATE SECTOR ADJUSTMENT LOAN,TF029663-PHRD-PRIVATE SECTOR DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Private Sector Adjustment Loan aims
            to: 1) accelerate state-owned enterprise (SOE)
            privatization, enforce hard budget constraints on remaining
            SOEs, and implement an action plan to stimulate private
            sector development and streamline the business environment;
            2) gradually strengthening the banking system, ensure that
            state banks are restructured, develop further the government
            securities market; 3) create income support program for
            displaced workers, improve employment services for displaced
            workers, strengthen the social assistance programs for the
            long-term unemployed and poor, and inform the general public
            about the rationale for the reform. In terms of benefits,
            this project will enhance Romania's prospect for
            growth, and sustain its macroeconomic stabilization.
            Privatization will increase economic efficiency. Stronger
            governance will reduce losses and arrears in the SOE sector.
            Financial sector reform will provide the basis for
            developing a new capital market. The main risks stem from
            the political difficulty of implementing the ambitious
            program. However, the government has shown commitment to see
            through the program. Another risk is the negative impact on
            poverty because of job losses, weak social safety nets, and
            low wages. This risk is partly mitigated by the unemployment
            insurance, severance pay, micro-credit, etc. provided by
            this project.
